---
title: Create a DID
---

import CodeSnippet from '@site/src/components/CodeSnippet';

## Create a DID automatically

The `Web5.connect()` function creates a decentralized identifier (DID) or obtains connection to an existing one either by direct creation or connection to an [identity agent app](/docs/web5/learn/agents). This function also creates an instance of Web5.
See more details in the [API reference](/api/web5-js/#connectoptions).

<CodeSnippet functionName="createDidAutomatically" />

By default, the `Web5.connect()` function creates the DID using the [ION DID method](/docs/web5/learn/decentralized-identifiers#didion).

Here’s an example of what the `myDid` object will look like:

```
did:ion:EiD3a17O2DCebpcZli-1BHRtMQ0LtTfrU85hHnAux6LrRQ:
```

## Create a DID manually

The `Web5.connect()` function above is the preferred way to create a DID, but there may be a case where you need to create another DID in real time. You can do so by calling [did.create()](/api/web5-js/did#createmethod-options).

When calling `create()`, be sure to pass in a [Web5-supported DID method](/docs/web5/learn/decentralized-identifiers#methods).

<CodeSnippet functionName="createDidManually" />

Here’s an example of what the `myDid` object will look like:

```js
{
  id: 'did:ion:EiDkWWhFezuDhJkGDJBmuIGDO2oOmzWVaL6SgWIyjqaJTw:',
  internalId: 'did:ion:EiDkWWhFezuDhJkGDJBmuIGDO2oOmzWVaL6SgWIyjqaJTw',
  didDocument: {
    '@context': 'https://www.w3.org/ns/did/v1',
    id: 'did:ion:EiDkWWhFezuDhJkGDJBmuIGDO2oOmzWVaL6SgWIyjqaJTw:',
    verificationMethod: [ [Object] ],
    authentication: [ '#dwn' ]
  },
  methodData: [
    {
      operation: 'create',
      content: [Object],
      recovery: [Object],
      update: [Object]
    }
  ],
  keys: [
    {
      id: 'did:ion:EiDkWWhFezuDhJkGDJBmuIGDO2oOmzWVaL6SgWIyjqaJTw:#dwn',
      type: 'JsonWebKey2020',
      controller: 'did:ion:EiDkWWhFezuDhJkGDJBmuIGDO2oOmzWVaL6SgWIyjqaJTw:',
      publicKeyJwk: [Object],
      privateKeyJwk: [Object]
    }
  ]
}
```
